name: Sea Air Inn Morro Bay

reviews.title: A Good Budget Priced Motel
reviews.text: Morro Bay is the ideal place to stay for a night if you're travelling down Highway1. This is a low-key, working town with a pleasant harbour and friendly bars and restaurants. It lacks the sophistication of other small towns and cities on the west coast but has great "small town America" charm. If you're travelling out of season you can get a decent room at the Ascot Inn for less than $50. Friendly staff and a good location close to the harbour and restaurants. Rooms are a good size, bathrooms are on the small side but clean and tidy. If you plan on staying longer, the Ascot Suites (more expensive, but higher quality) are probably a better choice.

reviews.title: Ripoff
reviews.text: Don't stay at this hotel unless you are prepared for aweful furniture, old beds, room cleaning by request, and noisy rooms. The Ascot web site is very misleading! Contential Breakfast ? Yea, after I saw their dog eat a egg off the carptet floor lobby !

reviews.title: Noisy at the Ascot Inn...
reviews.text: The staff could care less about you staying there...

reviews.title: Ok but nothing fancy
reviews.text: We arrived at the Ascot Inn (not equal to the suites -- which looked much nicer but were closed while we were there...) and ended up in a small but pleasantly furnished and clean room. It was disappointing that one of the lights didn't work on the lightstand next to the bed. However, our major disappointment was in discovering that it was an extremely noisy room - we could hear all of the activity of our neighbors above and on the sides -- too much activity. While I'll admit we probably 'lucked out' as far as our neighbors go, the experience was topped off by the loudest plumbing I can recall experiencing... In short, if you are hard of hearing or simply aren't sensitive to sound -- e.g., you don't mind hearing your neighbors intimate moments or their conversations... or being woken up at 6AM by the deafening sound of the plumbing...then you will probably find the experience reasonable...(unless you're looking for a quality continental breakfast...we were disappointed to discover that not only were the muffins and pastries of apparent store-bought quality but there was no fresh fruit, etc...). On the other hand, the rooms were clean, the staff courteous, etc...

reviews.title: Great place and location! May 23rd to May 25th, 2004
reviews.text: In short: if you don't like it noisy, I'd keep on looking and spend the extra $$ for a room elsewhere...

reviews.title: Ascot Inn was perfect for us!
reviews.text: My husband and I decided on Morro Bay for a mid-week getaway. We reserved a room at the Ascot Inn online. The hotel pictures we saw online were very accurate. Our room was very clean and charming. We loved it. I don't think we used our car once. The hotel was located right in the middle of everything. We look forward to our next visit.

reviews.title: Ascot Inn SUCKS, Ascot Suites are SWEET.
reviews.text: I read the two previous reviews and booked the Ascot Inn. What a mistake. Room 123 ceilings were cracked and the place look like hell.

reviews.title: Friendly but small
reviews.text: No soap provided. Chezzie! The manager moved me to the Ascot Suites for the same price. The suites are sweet, but the best deal is during week days. $99. for returning guests. The manager, Felix, says the Ascot Inn will be demolished at some point. I would not pay more than $75. a night to stay at the Inn. The suites are worth up to $200. a night if you ask me. Bon Voyage!

aka: Sea Air Inn Morro Bay Hotel Morro Bay
